io.sphere.client.model

Class EmptyReference<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.sphere.client.model.Reference<T>
      • io.sphere.client.model.EmptyReference<T>

  • public class EmptyReference<T>
extends Reference<T>
    A null object signalling that a reference field in some parent object was empty, to prevent NullPointerExceptions and provide better error messages.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      • create

        public static <T> Reference<T> create(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Creates a dummy empty reference that serves as a null object to prevent NullPointerExceptions.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - Name of the attribute in the parent object where the reference is used, for better error messages.

      • isExpanded

        public boolean isExpanded()
        Checks whether a reference has been expanded. User code should always check for isExpanded before calling get(). This way, the user won't get an exception even if the reference was empty in the parent object.
        Overrides:
        isExpanded in class Reference<T>

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Description copied from class: Reference
        True if this reference has no value in the parent object. If Reference.isEmpty() returns true, there's not much to do with this reference - Reference.isExpanded() will return false and all other methods will throw a ReferenceException.
        Overrides:
        isEmpty in class Reference<T>

      • get

        public T get()
      throws ReferenceException
        Description copied from class: Reference
        Returns the object represented by this reference. If the reference has not been expanded, throws a ReferenceException. Never returns null.
        Overrides:
        get in class Reference<T>
        Throws:
        ReferenceException - If this reference has not been expanded.
